item.title: Global PALSAR-2 Forest Non-Forest
item.description: It was developed by the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) using L-band synthetic aperture radar sensors on the Advanced Land Observing Satellite-2 (ALOS-2 PALSAR-2) and Advanced Land Observing Satellite (ALOS PALSAR).

item.title: Global Surface Temperature Change
item.description: It is a collaborative effort between the Global Land Analysis and Discovery (GLAD) lab at the University of Maryland, Google, the United States Geological Survey (USGS), and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA).

item.title: ESRI 2020 Land Cover
item.description: It was developed using Sentinel-2 imagery with a 10 m resolution and deep learning methods. The forest class is coded as 2 and defined as dense vegetation clustering of trees taller than 15 m, typically with a closed or dense canopy.

item.title: ESA WorldCover 2020
item.description: It is a collaborative effort between the European Space Agency (ESA) and multiple research institutions worldwide, utilizing imagery from Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2.

item.title: Finer Resolution Observation and Monitoring Global LC
item.description: Global land cover product created by Gong Peng et al., from Tsinghua University, in 2017. Based on 10 m resolution Sentinel-2 imagery and was produced using a random forest classifier.

item.title: A Comparison of Six Forest Mapping Products in Southeast Asia
item.description: Forest Mapping Comparison.pdf Introduction ¬ß Forest mapping products utilized for monitor and assess the status and changes in forests. However, substantial disparities exist among these products due to variations in forest definitions, classification methods, and data source.

item.title: Continuous Change Detection and Classification
item.description: It‚Äôs an algorithm used in remote sensing area for land cover analysis. The original methods published form paper titled ‚ÄúContinuous change detection and classification of land cover using all available Landsat data‚Äù, published in 11 February 2014.

item.title: Impact of Land Cover on Environmental Processes
item.description: Land cover influence the energy balance, carbon budget, and. hydrological cycle as many different physical characteristics change as a function of land cover, such as albedo, emissivity, roughness, photosynthetic capacity and transpiration.

item.title: Phenology and sun angle differences in landsat data
item.description: Phenology: Refers to the study of cyclic and seasonal natural phenomena, especially in relation to climate and plant and animal life. In the context of Landsat data, phenology affects the imagery because different seasons show varying characteristics of vegetation, water bodies, and other land features.

item.title: Challenges on land cover change detection
item.description: Previous research: Clouds could reduce the amount of usable data. It‚Äôs hard to find an ideal pair of Landsat images that are free of clouds, cloud shadows and snow Previous change detection algorithm over shorter time intervals has a limitations.
